alert.note: Alert for New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 28 at 3:46AM EST until December 28 at 10:30AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Delaware... White Clay Creek Near Newark affecting New Castle County. For the White Clay Creek...including Newark...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White Clay Creek near Newark. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flooding begins into adjacent open fields. At 13.3 feet, Delaware Route 7, Stanton Christiana Road, begins to flood. At 13.5 feet, Businesses on Delaware Route 7 begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 AM EST Thursday the stage was 13.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:15 AM EST Thursday was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early this morning and continue falling to 5.5 feet tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.3 feet on 10/28/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (4 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Stg Time Date White Clay Creek Newark 13.0 13.1 Thu 3 am 5.5 MSG 13.1 4am 12/28 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1030 AM EST.
